pageContext.description: leaf shaped dagger, in outline very much like a leaf shaped sword.  One rivet hole in tang.
pageContext.patina: Golden bronze colour, in the pits are small specks of light green, dark green + black patina.
pageContext.surface: Smooth + in good condition, slightly pitted in parts, especially on the tang.
pageContext.collection: (c/o Rev A C Tranter, Runnemede Vicarage, Egham.),Now BM.   1947. 7-4. 1.
pageContext.site: England,R Thames - (SURREY),Egham, at Runnymede. Sept 4. 1934., "The River here is about 7-9ft deep + the Council Surveyor reckons that the dredging reached about 4ft below that: - i.e. the dredger reached about 12ft down".,Letter from Rev AC Tranter (Egham) of Dec 16, 1936.
pageContext.toSearch: Runnymede, Windsor Road, Old Windsor, Surrey Sl4 2jl, UK
pageContext.remarks: Inacc drawing,Unusual shape, the nearest in shape, not in size, is the tanged dagger from Winmarleigh, Lancs.
